_comment: ISO international standards database. ISO standards are developed by the International Organization for Standardization and are widely adopted globally. Many are referenced by national regulations. Updated for 2025 compliance requirements.

norms.name: Quality Management Systems - Requirements
norms.applies_to: Organizations of all sizes and sectors
norms.description: Specifies requirements for a quality management system. Organizations use the standard to demonstrate ability to consistently provide products and services that meet customer and regulatory requirements.

norms.name: Environmental Management Systems - Requirements
norms.applies_to: Organizations wanting to improve environmental performance
norms.description: Specifies requirements for an environmental management system to enhance environmental performance and demonstrate commitment to environmental protection.

norms.name: Occupational Health and Safety Management Systems
norms.applies_to: Organizations of all sizes concerned with occupational health and safety
norms.description: Specifies requirements for an OH&S management system to provide safe and healthy workplaces, prevent work-related injury and ill health.

norms.name: Information Security Management Systems - Requirements
norms.description: Specifies requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continually improving an information security management system (ISMS).

norms.name: Information Security Controls
norms.description: Provides guidance on organizational information security standards and information security management practices including controls for selection and implementation.

norms.name: Privacy Information Management
norms.description: Extension to ISO/IEC 27001 and 27002 for privacy information management. Relevant for GDPR and other privacy regulations compliance.

norms.name: Common Criteria for IT Security Evaluation
norms.description: Framework for specifying security functional and assurance requirements for IT products and systems. Used for security certification.

norms.name: IT Service Management Systems
norms.description: Specifies requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continually improving a service management system (SMS).

norms.name: General Requirements for Testing and Calibration Laboratories
norms.description: Specifies general requirements for competence, impartiality and consistent operation of laboratories. Required for lab accreditation.

norms.name: Conformity Assessment - Product Certification Bodies
norms.description: Contains requirements for bodies certifying products, processes and services. Ensures consistency and credibility of certification.

norms.name: Medical Devices - Quality Management Systems
norms.description: Specifies requirements for quality management systems where organizations need to demonstrate ability to provide medical devices and related services that consistently meet customer and regulatory requirements.

norms.name: Medical Devices - Application of Risk Management
norms.description: Specifies terminology, principles and process for risk management of medical devices including software as a medical device.

norms.name: Biological Evaluation of Medical Devices - Part 1
norms.applies_to: Medical devices with patient or user contact
norms.description: Framework for biological evaluation and testing of medical devices within a risk management process. Part of comprehensive 10993 series.

norms.name: Medical Device Software - Life Cycle Processes
norms.description: Defines life cycle requirements for medical device software development and maintenance. Safety classification based on potential harm.

norms.name: Medical Devices - Usability Engineering
norms.description: Specifies process for manufacturers to analyze, specify, develop and evaluate usability of medical devices. Focuses on safety-related use errors.

norms.name: Medical Laboratories - Requirements for Quality and Competence
norms.description: Specifies requirements for quality and competence specific to medical laboratories. Used for laboratory accreditation.

norms.name: Road Vehicles - Functional Safety - Part 1
norms.description: International standard for functional safety of electrical and electronic systems in production automobiles. Part of comprehensive 12-part series.

norms.name: Road Vehicles - Cybersecurity Engineering
norms.description: Specifies cybersecurity engineering requirements for electrical and electronic systems in road vehicles throughout the lifecycle.

norms.name: Financial Services - Universal Financial Industry Message Scheme - Part 1
norms.description: Updated messaging standard for financial services. ISO 20022 methodology and metamodel. Widely adopted for payments, securities, cards.

norms.name: Road Vehicles - Environmental Conditions and Testing - Electrical/Electronic Equipment
norms.description: Specifies environmental conditions and tests for electrical and electronic equipment in road vehicles. Multi-part standard covering climatic, mechanical, chemical conditions.

norms.name: Explosive Atmospheres - Application of Quality Systems
norms.description: Specifies quality system requirements for manufacturers of equipment intended for use in explosive atmospheres. Complements ATEX/IECEx.

norms.name: Explosive Atmospheres - General Requirements
norms.description: Specifies general requirements for construction, testing and marking of electrical equipment for explosive gas atmospheres.

norms.name: Energy Management Systems - Requirements
norms.applies_to: Organizations of all types and sizes
norms.description: Specifies requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and improving an energy management system to improve energy performance.

norms.name: Environmental Management - Life Cycle Assessment - Principles and Framework
norms.applies_to: Products and services requiring lifecycle assessment
norms.description: Describes principles and framework for life cycle assessment (LCA) including definition of goal and scope, inventory analysis, impact assessment.

norms.name: Environmental Management - Life Cycle Assessment - Requirements and Guidelines
norms.description: Specifies requirements and provides guidelines for life cycle assessment. Used with ISO 14040 for comprehensive LCA.

norms.name: Greenhouse Gases - Carbon Footprint of Products
norms.description: Specifies principles, requirements and guidelines for quantification and communication of carbon footprint of products.

norms.name: Food Safety Management Systems - Requirements
norms.description: Specifies requirements for food safety management system including interactive communication, system management, prerequisite programs, HACCP principles.

norms.name: Business Continuity Management Systems - Requirements
norms.description: Specifies requirements for planning, establishing, implementing, operating, monitoring and improving a business continuity management system.

norms.name: Risk Management - Guidelines
norms.description: Provides principles, framework and process for managing risk. Can be used by any organization regardless of size, activity or sector.

norms.name: Asset Management - Overview, Principles and Terminology
norms.description: Provides overview of asset management and asset management systems. Part of 55000 series for comprehensive asset management.

norms.name: Systems and Software Engineering - Software Life Cycle Processes
norms.description: Establishes common framework for software life cycle processes with well-defined terminology. Applicable to acquisition, supply, development, operation and maintenance.

norms.name: Systems and Software Quality Requirements and Evaluation (SQuaRE) - Product Quality Model
norms.description: Defines product quality model for software including functional suitability, performance efficiency, compatibility, usability, reliability, security, maintainability, portability.

norms.name: Cloud Services Information Security Controls
norms.description: Provides guidelines for information security controls for cloud services based on ISO/IEC 27002.

norms.name: Cloud Privacy
norms.description: Code of practice for protection of personally identifiable information (PII) in public clouds acting as PII processors.

norms.name: Privacy Framework
norms.description: Provides high-level privacy framework for protection of PII within ICT systems. Defines privacy principles.

norms.name: Code of Practice for PII Protection
norms.description: Code of practice for protecting personally identifiable information. Links to ISO/IEC 27001 for PII protection.

norms.name: Quality Management - Guidelines for Project Management
norms.description: Provides guidelines for quality management in projects. Applicable to projects of varying complexity, small or large, short or long duration.

norms.name: Project, Programme and Portfolio Management - Context and Concepts
norms.description: Provides high-level description of concepts and processes that are considered to form good practice in project, programme and portfolio management.

norms.name: Financial Services - Universal Financial Industry Message Scheme
norms.description: Methodology for developing financial message standards. Used for payments, securities, trade services, cards and foreign exchange.

norms.name: Date and Time - Representations for Information Interchange
norms.description: Specifies representations of dates, times of day, time intervals and recurring time intervals for information interchange.

norms.name: Software Product Quality Requirements and Evaluation (SQuaRE) - COTS Software
norms.description: Provides requirements and recommendations for quality requirements and testing of commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) software products.

norms.name: Information Technology - Process Assessment (SPICE)
norms.description: Framework for assessment of software processes. Also known as SPICE (Software Process Improvement and Capability Determination).

norms.name: Artificial Intelligence - Management System
norms.applies_to: Organizations developing or using AI systems
norms.description: First ISO standard for AI management systems. Specifies requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and continually improving an AI management system.

norms.name: Artificial Intelligence - Risk Management
norms.description: Provides guidance on risk management for AI systems throughout the lifecycle.

norms.name: Artificial Intelligence Concepts and Terminology
norms.description: Establishes terminology and concepts for artificial intelligence. Provides foundation for AI standards.

norms.name: Anti-Bribery Management Systems
norms.description: Specifies requirements for establishing, implementing, maintaining and improving an anti-bribery management system.

norms.name: Compliance Management Systems - Requirements with Guidance
norms.description: Specifies requirements for establishing, developing, implementing, evaluating, maintaining and improving an effective compliance management system.

norms.name: Measurement Management Systems
norms.description: Specifies generic requirements and provides guidance for management of measurement processes and metrological confirmation of measuring equipment.

norms.name: Safety Aspects - Guidelines for their Inclusion in Standards
norms.description: Provides guidelines for including safety aspects in standards for products, processes and services at all stages of life cycle.

norms.name: Consumer Product Safety - Guidelines for Suppliers
norms.description: Provides guidance to suppliers on developing and implementing appropriate customer-focused processes related to consumer product safety.
